title: How to Move the Task Bar to the Top of the Screen

steps.title: Right-clicking the Start button on Windows 7 opens a small menu.
steps.content: Right-clicking the Start button on Windows 7 opens a small menu.

steps.title: This opens a new box will open called "Taskbar and Start Menu Properties".
steps.content: This opens a new box will open called "Taskbar and Start Menu Properties". If this window doesn't open to the Taskbar tab, click the tab to go there now.

steps.title: This is the first checkbox at the top of the window.
steps.content: This is the first checkbox at the top of the window. This will allow the task bar to be modified.

steps.title: The window will close.
steps.content: The window will close. You can now move the taskbar.

steps.title: With the mouse over the Task bar icon, hold down the right mouse button and drag it to the side.
steps.content: With the mouse over the Task bar icon, hold down the right mouse button and drag it to the side. After dragging it to the side you can drag it up to the top.
